target.name: usage
target.description: show help

echo.message: all --> generates xmlBlaster.jar (including demo and testsuite classes)
dist --> generates the xmlBlaster distribution to run as a server
-DADD_PROP=[property file] Adds your customized xmlBlaster.properties file
-DADD_PLUGINPROP=[xml file] Adds your customized xmlBlasterPlugins.xml file
-DADD_LOGGINGPROP=[property file] Adds your customized logging.properties file
-DADD_MANIFEST=[manifest file] Adds your customized manifest.xmlBlaster file
-DADD_DIRECTORY=[directory] Adds all class files in the specified directory
-DADD_JAVACLIENTS=false basic java clients (XmlScript and some HelloWorld*) [true]
clean --> cleans up the class directory
delete --> cleans up the class directory and all created distribution jar files
deploy_war --> create and deploys a web archive (e.g. for tomcat) to show persistent http callbacks
j2me --> create and deploys a j2me application. For this you need to install Sun's
WTK2.1 SDK for embedded java. Invoke it as follows:
j2me-run --> runs the deployed j2me application in the installed emulator. Invoke
jboss-sar --> create embedded XmlBlaster for JBoss
jms-adapter --> create the J2EE connector example bean
dist-client --> create for a typical client the necessary xmlBlasterClient.jar file
-DADD_HSQLDB=false does not add hsqldb.jar, no embedded database support [true]
-DADD_CORBA=false does not add jacorb.jar, no CORBA support for clients [true]
-DADD_XMLRPC=false does not add xmlrpc.jar, no XMLRPC support for clients [true]
-DADD_SNMP=false does not add jax.jar, no SNMP support for clients [false]
-DADD_PROP=[property file] Adds your customized xmlBlaster.properties file
-DADD_LOGGINGPROP=[property file] Adds your customized logging.properties file
-DADD_MANIFEST=[manifest file] Adds your customized manifest.xmlBlaster file
-DADD_DIRECTORY=[directory] Adds all class files in the specified directory
Check build.properties settings for C++ CORBA and C++ XML libraries
cpp --> builds cpp-lib, cpp-test and cpp-demo
cpp-clean --> cleans up C++ generated files (object files, corba files etc)
cpp-delete --> like 'cpp-clean', but delete shared library and C++ test clients as well
c-lib --> generates the C client library libxmlBlasterClientC.sl (shared library .so .sl .dll)
c --> builds c-lib, c-test and c-demo
c-clean --> cleans up C generated files (object files etc)
c-delete --> like 'c-clean', but delete shared library and C test clients as well
activex --> Creates a Windows ActiveX Bridge (for use with C# and VisualBasic.Net)
contrib --> Builds all classes found in the org.xmlBlaster.contrib directory into xmlBlasterContrib.jar
DbWatcher --> Builds all classes necessary for the DbWatcher
runTests --> compiles and starts xmlBlaster and runs all JUNIT tests
report --> after 'runTests' you can generate a HTML report
-Dtest.class=nameOfTestClass runJunit --> run junit on the specifyed testclass
javadocs --> generates the complete javadoc documentation
javadocs-client --> generates the client side javadoc documentation
html --> generates the html file of each java/cpp/python ... file in same directory
requirements--> generates html files for all xml requirements
whitepaper --> generates html and pdf files for our xml whitepaper
docs --> does javadoc, source-html, requirements and whitepaper
See the comments inside the build.xml file for more details.
